alert.note: Alert for Berrien; Cook; Lanier; Lowndes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 25 at 1:55PM EDT until March 25 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Cook County in south central Georgia... Southeastern Berrien County in south central Georgia... Lanier County in south central Georgia... North central Lowndes County in south central Georgia... * Until 245 PM EDT. * At 155 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Adel, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Nashville and Ray City around 210 PM EDT. Lakeland around 225 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Courthouse, Cottle, Cook Co A/P, Berrien Co A/P, New Lois, Massee, Pine Valley, Hansell, Meigs and Allenville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
